column1: CBT: Specific sequence of meetings and actions can cause the archive page to not display for specific meeting
column25:
*Note: will be fixed after 9/12 deployment*

The end issue is that the cbt archived files will not display if a specific sequence of actions is done on a single meeting. Exact cause is unknown or to what extent the data is affected (if the files have been deleted, or flag being set wrong, or query for archived briefs needs to be fixed).

{color:#f6c342}NOTE: when the steps tell you go to a different cbt page it is expected that you select the brief that you created before performing actions listed in the step.{color}

Steps
1) Make a brief with the following conditions
-a start time soon (1-5 minutes so that the meeting can be finished soon)
-1 minute duration
-at least one contributor
-recurrence pattern of daily, no end date
2) Go to meeting and upload a powerpoint to the contributor
3) Wait for meeting to end
4) After ending verify that the brief was archived
5) Go to brief admin -> Configure Brief Recurrence -> Click button at the bottom that says 'Remove Recurrence' (something like that, its the right most button in the popup)
6) Now Go to Manage Brief Occurrence
7) Add a single occurence that starts soon (again we want it to end soon) and duration of 1 minute
8) Go to slide manager and add slide to contributor (or move the previously archive slide to active, which slide doesn't matter just that it has a slide)
9) Wait for meeting to end
10) confirm on the archive page that there are two archived files
11) Go to brief admin page
12) Click configure brief recurrence
13) Set the recurrence pattern to the same conditions as step 1
14) Go to Manage Brief Occurences and modify the first instance to end within a few minutes (again so it ends soon)
15) Repeat steps 8+9
16) Go to archive page, there are only two archived files when there should be three
17) Go to brief admin -> Configure Brief Recurrence -> remove recurrence using the button again
18) Go to archive page and now all archived files for the specific brief you've been modifying are gone

column1: Some users are unable to login to the PACOM LOGCOP
column25:
There are reports of some users not being able to login to the PACOM LOGCOP. This appears to be the same thing that happened to Marc yesterday when he couldn't login. At the time, I thought it was a bug in SSO, but now it looks like this is not the case.  

Update: I am now unable to login.  I think the issue the other day, where I couldn't login after I fired up the fuels data feed was actually this same bug.

column108:
31/Mar/16 9:30 AM;logcop.enterprise;This solution in IE will only work for versions 10+, should work in Firefox

It has been found that it is possible to save the screen shot to a html canvas element using html2canvas (javascript file pulled from https://github.com/niklasvh/html2canvas or https://html2canvas.hertzen.com/).
NOTE: in the html2canvas.js file one change had to be made to work with our code:
-on line 941 '(nodeList === undefined)' ----> '(nodeList === undefined || nodeList == null)'
Also html2canvas needs a polyfill class called Promise: https://github.com/taylorhakes/promise-polyfill

Saving the canvas to an image file can be done by using FileSaver.js (https://github.com/eligrey/FileSaver.js/). This works by taking the blob (javascript element type) of the canvas and then will automatically save it into a file type that we pass in.
NOTE: this needs a polyfill as well: canvas-toBlob.js (https://github.com/eligrey/canvas-toBlob.js/).

This solution has been confirmed to be working if the canvas does not become tainted in the process.

Issues:
-html2canvas generates the image on the canvas offset due to it directly translating the div section which places the map panel using an absolute position. The source code for html2canvas will need to be modified to strip out the absolute positioning of the map and extra logic will be needed client side to match the canvas elements size to the image size.
-The Google map images are retrieved from a different server which marks the images as being 'cross-origin' and causes the canvas to be marked as tainted. A tainted canvas can't be converted to the data type needed to export the image, this is a security feature of browsers. This is because local files can be also added to a canvas which would make it possible for hacker to grab local images place it into a canvas and then send the image to their server.
   -Solution: the only possible solution would be to use our server as a proxy for the Google map images which would allow us to set a header on them to allow cross-origin and therefore let the images to be drawn to a canvas without tainting it.

To get code/js sources ask Marc for the 'Map To Image Code' folder

-Marc Mendoza

column1: Analyze TRMS Ornance files
Upload/Parse TRMS Ordnance
column25:
LOGCOP Dev needs the ability to either manually or automatically (using Exchange Web Service) upload and parse Ordnance data that comes from NRRE-BI. The data then needs to persist into the existing db.
The Ordnance data is presented at the top of the Ship Summary pop-up as "OVERALL". Hovering over the status icon displays the comment text
Database table: ship_trms_ordnance
(Pre-note: C:/dev/logcop/scripts/utilities/database_zipfiles.txt needs Ordnance file names to be appended with " en-us" in the file name such that it matches the files that arrive daily in the emails)
Steps for processing:
1)  Moves Ordnance files to TRMS.zip (1100 Seat 2 Update Prep.bat)
2) Look in database_zipfiles.txt for file names, and upload them.
3) Calls the processOrdnanceXlsfile methods
4) After each file is processed, then it will run the processOrdnanceReadiness() method
5) All 3 Ordnance readiness files data are aggregated into a HashMap 
6) Truncate call is made to the load_ship_trms_ordnance table
7) The ordnance readiness data loaded/prepared/staged into the load_ship_trms_ordnance table
8) The stored procedure call "callLoadShipTrmsOrdnanceProc" will do the final load into the ship_trms_ordnance table
